weka.clusterers

Class LFCluster.Coordinate

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.clusterers.LFCluster.Coordinate
  • Enclosing class:
    LFCluster

    protected class LFCluster.Coordinate
extends java.lang.Object
    Coordinate in an imaginary two-dimensional coordinate system.

    Instances of this class describe a point in an imaginary two-dimensional coordinate system. Only integer values are allowed as coordinate values. The Coordinate can also contain negative values. This object is literally used as an object, that means other objects manipulate and use this object. Therefore the Coordinate members are also public. The Coordinate does not alter other objects, except itself, and is passive.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int x
      Position of this Coordinate on the x axis.
      int y
      Position of this Coordinate on the y axis.

        public void setX(int value)

      • moveUp

        public void moveUp(int steps)
        Moves this Coordinate up for a certain amount of steps on the coordinate system. When steps is negative, the coordinate is actually moved down.
        Parameters:
        steps - steps to move this coordinate up.

      • moveDown

        public void moveDown(int steps)
        Moves this Coordinate down for a certain amount of steps on the coordinate system. When steps is negative, the coordinate is actually moved up.
        Parameters:
        steps - steps to move this coordinate down.

      • moveLeft

        public void moveLeft(int steps)
        Moves this Coordinate left for a certain amount of steps on the coordinate system. When steps is negative, the coordinate is actually moved right.
        Parameters:
        steps - steps to move this coordinate left.

      • moveRight

        public void moveRight(int steps)
        Moves this Coordinate right for a certain amount of steps on the coordinate system. When steps is negative, the coordinate is actually moved left.
        Parameters:
        steps - steps to move this coordinate right.

      • add

        public void add(LFCluster.Coordinate diff)
        Adds a given coordinate to this Coordinate.

        Example: This Coordinate is (5,20), the coordinate to add is (5,-8), so the new position of this Coordinate is (10,12).

        Parameters:
        diff - the coordinate to add to this Coordinate.

      • isAboveOf

        public boolean isAboveOf(LFCluster.Coordinate coordinate)
        Tells if this Coordinate is above of another coordinate on the imaginary coordinate system.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - the coordinate to compare with.
        Returns:
        true, if this Coordinate is above the given coordinate, false, if the given coordinate is above this Coordinate or both coordinates are at the same height on the y axis.

      • isBelowOf

        public boolean isBelowOf(LFCluster.Coordinate coordinate)
        Tells if this Coordinate is below another coordinate on the imaginary coordinate system.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - the coordinate to compare with.
        Returns:
        true, if this Coordinate is below the given coordinate, false, if the given coordinate is below this Coordinate or both coordinates are at the same height on the y axis.

      • isLeftOf

        public boolean isLeftOf(LFCluster.Coordinate coordinate)
        Tells if this Coordinate is on the left of another coordinate on the imaginary coordinate system.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - the coordinate to compare with.
        Returns:
        true, if this Coordinate is on the left of the given coordinate, false, if the given coordinate is on the left of this Coordinate or both coordinates are at the same position on the x axis.

      • isRightOf

        public boolean isRightOf(LFCluster.Coordinate coordinate)
        Tells if this Coordinate is on the right of another coordinate on the imaginary coordinate system.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - the coordinate to compare with.
        Returns:
        true, if this Coordinate is on the right of the given coordinate, false, if the given coordinate is on the right of this Coordinate or both coordinates are at the same position on the x axis.

      • isDirectNeighborOf

        public boolean isDirectNeighborOf(LFCluster.Coordinate coordinate)
        Detects if a coordinate is a direct neighbor of this Coordinate. A coordinate is a direct neighbor of this Coordinate object, when it is directly above, below, left or right of this Coordinate.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - the coordinate to compare with.
        Returns:
        true, if coordinate is a direct neighbor, false otherwise.

      • hasSameX

        public boolean hasSameX(LFCluster.Coordinate coordinate)
        Tells if this Coordinate has the same x value like the given coordinate.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - the coordinate to compare with.
        Returns:
        true, if coordinate has the same x value like this one.
